ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: (Regarding the TA question, I realize that we did have a TA, and Ali is great in general, I just didn't happen to consult him for this class, hence the N/A)
As compared to classes at the School of Management, this courses took a much closer look at the empirical studies in the field and allowed us to dive much deeper into the material.

I really learnt a lot on this classes. Even though it was at 8.30 on a Monday morning it was really worth it. The classes were very interesting, the professor was very nice and he was able to make the class interesting and we could participate a lot in the class discussion. He also provided coffee!! (every Monday).

Apart from the content of environment&development, I have learned a lot in terms of tangible techniques like writing literature reviews. It involved a lot of work, but I think in the end learned a lot from it.
Going into the detail of academic papers, to be able to identify the strengths/shortcomings of a paper.Very good facilitation of class discussions.

I can't say enough good things about this course.The four short papers initially don't seem like anything different than other assignments for other courses, but the guide that Professor Gollin gave us really made us think about why the authors made the choices they did, and whether or not those were good choices. It really provoked deep thinking about the articles. I'd encourage other students to really take these papers seriously and follow the line of questioning Gollin proposes in his guide. It was hugely beneficial for me.The two assignments were also good, flexible enough to allow you to explore what you're interested in within the boundaries of the course.
To become familiar with how to understand the empirical papers.

The professor. Doug Gollin is clearly very knowledgeable, engaged and invested in the students gaining something important through this course. He was organized and designed a really productive semester.
the readings, and the discussions of these in class. very intellectually stimulating.
The open discussions in class were the best thing about this course. They allowed me to clarify the readings and lecture material and to better understand how to tackle the assignments.
good instructor; interesting topics; very empirical/econometric approach to the topics (which I don't get in many other classes)
How the class is structure. The topics, how we discussed in class and of course Prof. Gollin, that he was really good at explaining and making the class really interesting and fun at the same time.
The reading response assignments were a great way to dissect an academic paper and really understand it...
Learn important topics in the junction of environment and development. Reading was heavy but it was so valuable and I learned a lot out of it!
Prfessor's Gollin discussion and reading's selections.
- well structured- the instructor took much interest in students and student's learning- diverse topics were surveyed
- the professor

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: There was a lot of reading each week. I found it difficult to keep up with, but also could get a lot out of the discussion even on the articles I could not fully dive into.
The professor takes too long grading our papers, and we should have more time to take the take-home exam (8 hours is too short for writing 4 essays!)
too much weekly reading
Nothing
Graded homework to be handed back sooner... The class was somewhat large to have the discussion setting - was difficult to speak up in that kind of environment
mmm.. Maybe the exam was a bit too long/tough
another type of exam-it wasnt an 8 hours low stress exam!!different type of assignment-the second one was very similar to the first one
- faster feedback on first literature review- class size was a bit big for discussion class
- 8:30am starts

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Fantastic!
Both were very responsive when I needed assistance and flexibility.
only went to the professor's office hour once, had a question which he answered really well, it clarified things immediately.

Professor Gollin was always available for help. I contacted him on numerous occasions and he was always quick to respond. He helped me via email, meetings, and just quick conversations after class. The quality of help was always superb.
Dr. Gollin and Ali both always promptly answered e-mails and answered my questions with extreme helpfulness.
Both of them were always ready to help, to repeat and clarified topics.
Instructor would reply to emails very quickly
Both of them were very helpful! Whenever I asked help, I always got immediate response.
He was nice and wanted to help when needed
always avaible both
Both the instructor and TA were very flexible with their availability, and was very helpful.
Didn't use the TA

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This is something over and above what you'd get from just taking a development course and an environmental economics course. We were able to have discussions about both areas on a very advanced level. It didn't feel like anything was left out.
A great complement to my studies at SOM.
i'm a development economics student and i absolutely loved it - learned more about development and program evaluations in this course than in my core development econ class
Helped me understanding economic approach of environmental policy analysis.
Great if you want to get a sense of what development economics is and how it relates to environmental sissues
it offers an environmental approach to economic development, very helpful approach

With a broad range of topics covered in the context of environment and development, the course was overall very helpful to understand topics and approaches studied in development economics.The way he explained econometrics approaches without being so technical, and the main themes by connecting a number of literatures eased my understanding of ongoing research interest.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I am interested in the environment economics.
The topic interests me.
i was interested!
I took this course to explore the intersection between human development and environmental protection in the developing world
I was interested to learn about environemntal issues in developing countries and how they can be tied into other issues and policies faced by the government in these countries.
to learn more about issues in developing countries, and to take an economics approach to developing world problems
I am a development economist interesting in environmental topics, so this course was a perfect match,
In line with my academic track here at Yale
See 15
because I am interested on how the development process is related with environment
Do understand how environment and development issues interact each other as often times they are viewed in conflict.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: Yes
yes! Surpassed my expectations.
definitely.
Yes, very much so.
Yes
Yes! totally
Exceeded my expectations in terms of how much it taught me
Yes!
Yes!
yes.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes
Yes
yes, absolutely.
Yes, I learned a lot of the conceptual and technical information I had hoped to gain from the class.
Yes
The course was more that I expected! Excellent course
yes
Yes
yes

more than what I expected. not only a number of topics were surveyd to understand the relationship between environment interest and development interest, writing techniques were practiced through assignments like writing reading responses.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: we studied different topics that we couldn't cover in the class. it was great.

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Spend some real time writing the short papers. It's worth what you learn from them.
It is an excellent course.

There is a lot of reading, and quite a bit of work. But it evenly paced throughout the semester. The quality of the class depends much on the students in the room, as well as the professor's discussion facilitation. I think it was a GREAT course.
keep up with the pace, do all the readings!
keep up with the weekly readings and try to participate in class to get the most out of it
That they have to read a lot! but it's worth the effort
Great breadth of topics covered - you really learn how to read papers in a better way
I believe everyone should take this class. If you haven't taken stats or econ, you might find it rough going trough the readings.
prepare readings in advance and participate a lot in class
